sect1.title: &productnameshort; and v2v support
sect1.para: The virt-v2v utility provides an easy way to convert virtual machines from one hypervisor format to another (for example, from Xen to KVM). In the case of Windows* guests running under Xen, this conversion process includes support for the automatic deployment of the &productnameshort;.

sect2.title: &productnameshort; RPM package
sect2.para: The virt-v2v-vmdp RPM is a repackaging of the Windows* &productnameshort; drivers into a directory structure usable by the virt-v2v utility. After being installed on a KVM host, any Windows* guests migrated to that host using the virt-v2v process can have the &productnameshort; drivers automatically installed.

By default, virt-v2v will first check for the existence of the &productnameshort; on the Windows* guest undergoing conversion. If found on the guest, and the virt-v2v-vmdp RPM is installed on the target host (the machine running the virt-v2v process), virt-v2v will automatically install the &productnameshort; drivers as part of the conversion. This driver reinstallation is required to replace Xen specific drivers with virtio drivers for use with KVM.

sect2.title: v2v --vmdp parameter
sect2.para: Installation of the &productnameshort; can be manually influenced during virt-v2v migration using the â€“-vmdp parameter:

listitem.para: --vmdp=auto: only install the &productnameshort; if already installed on source image
--vmdp=always: always install the &productnameshort; during Windows* guest conversions

sect2.para: In addition to installing the drivers included with the virt-v2v-vmdp RPM, it is possible for virt-v2v to copy the &productnameshort; setup program itself to the converted guest. While not required, if the virt-v2v host is configured to perform this, the &productnameshort; setup program will be automatically ran upon first login. This will ensure the install/uninstall program is registered with Windows* and any residual Xen drivers are correctly uninstalled. To allow for this capability, the &productnameshort; setup program (VMDP-WIN-VERSION.exe) must be copied to /var/lib/virt-v2v/software/windows on the virt-v2v host. After copying the executable in place, ensure the setup executable name is correctly specified in /var/lib/virt-v2v/virt-v2v.db as follows:
sect2.screen: <!-- SUSE Virtual Machine Driver Pack (VMDP) setup program --> <app os='windows' name='vmdp'> <path>windows/VMDP-WIN-VERSION.exe</path> </app>
sect2.para: The virt-v2v-vmdp RPM is available in the same download location as the &productnameshort; setup program.
